bio.summary: MISIA (born Misaki Ito (伊藤美咲, Ito Misaki) on July 7, 1978 in Fukuoka, Fukuoka, Japan) is an accomplished Japanese rnb and pop singer-songwriter who debuted in February 1998 with the song つつみ込むように… after being spotted at an audition in May 1997. She has since become one of most successful Japanese recording artists, selling over 30 million records. She has released eightheen albums: nine studio albums, three compilations, five remix albums and one live album, of which seven reached #1 on the Oricon charts. Her song Everything was the best-selling single by a female artist of the last decade.
bio.content: MISIA (born Misaki Ito (伊藤美咲, Ito Misaki) on July 7, 1978 in Fukuoka, Fukuoka, Japan) is an accomplished Japanese rnb and pop singer-songwriter who debuted in February 1998 with the song つつみ込むように… after being spotted at an audition in May 1997. She has since become one of most successful Japanese recording artists, selling over 30 million records. She has released eightheen albums: nine studio albums, three compilations, five remix albums and one live album, of which seven reached #1 on the Oricon charts. Her song Everything was the best-selling single by a female artist of the last decade. She has earned seven Japan Gold Disc awards including: New Artist of the Year (1999); Pop Album of the Year (Mother Brother Father Sister, 1999); Pop Album of the Year (LOVE IS THE MESSAGE, 2000); Song of the Year (Everything, 2001); Pop Album of the Year (MARVELOUS, 2002); Pop Album of the Year (KISS IN THE SKY, 2003); Pop Album of the Year (MISIA GREATEST HITS, 2003). She is one of Japan's most popular live performers, with each of her concerts being sold out. She is the first female artist to have toured all five main domes of Japan. MISIA is best known for her five-octave vocal range, her puzzling fashion style and for being one the few artists in Japan to have never performed on TV music shows. She has the ability to use the whistle register, which is put to good use in her songs. While it's common to find MISIA described as an rnb artist her music has a more soulful, even bluesy, quality to it, something her voice complements well. Since 2001, she has been engaging in environmental and human rights activisim. In 2008, she founded Child AFRICA, an organization aimed at supporting education and creating sustainable societies. In 2010, she was named Honorary Ambassador of the 10th Conference of the Parties of the Convention on Biological Diversity. MISIA is not to be confused with the Portuguese fado singer, Mísia.
